intro: Mikania neglecta, commonly known as littleleaf morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the Convolvulaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and heart-shaped leaves that are typically less than 5 centimeters in diameter. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pale purple, often blooming in clusters. Mikania neglecta is native to the Americas and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. It is considered an invasive species in some regions due to its rapid growth and ability to spread aggressively.
